issue.title: caplog.clear() removes records but leaves collected .text

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: problem that needs to be addressed

labels.name: plugin: logging
labels.description: related to the logging builtin plugin

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
## Problem
Currently (see *pytest* versions below), method `LogCaptureHandler.clear()` removes all records from the handler, but it does not clear the collected text in it's `.stream`, leading to contradictory results:
https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/blob/07e768ab68ad44bdf2c441d0ba7524d646ffdbf8/_pytest/logging.py#L240-L244
https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/blob/07e768ab68ad44bdf2c441d0ba7524d646ffdbf8/_pytest/logging.py#L220-L224

## Example
```python
import logging

def test_caplog_clear(caplog):
    rlog = logging.getLogger()

    rlog.error("Hi there!")
    assert "Hi there!" in caplog.text

    caplog.clear()
    assert all("Hi there!" not in r for r in caplog.records)
    assert "Hi there!" not in caplog.text  # Fails!
```
## Suggestion
One can either add this line into `.clear()`:
```python
self.handler.stream = py.io.TextIO()
```
OR add this one, which will work also for clients holding handler's `stream` property:
```python
self.handler.stream.truncate(0)
```

## Versions
```bash
pip list |grep pytest
pytest (3.4.2)
pytest-cov (2.5.1)
pytest-cover (3.0.0)
pytest-coverage (0.0)
pytest-mock (1.7.1)
pytest-runner (4.0)
```

issue.title: Remove use of attrs

labels.name: type: question
labels.description: general question, might be closed after 2 weeks of inactivity

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
So I'm having an issue with this https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/commit/07b2b18a01a3ba12757a4eb1c0e082922f5299e5

My project is stuck in a little dependency hell caused by attrs and it's lack of stability. One release removes some stuff, one month later another release adds some other stuff and so on. Some package depends on removed behavior (like accessing attributes via class), pytest depends on new features (converters or something).

Can we revert 07b2b18a01a3ba12757a4eb1c0e082922f5299e5 - I really don't see what it improves.
